messages.title: Dear Neighbour
messages.content: I am writing to introduce myself to you as the Liberal Democrat candidate for Rushcliffe for the forthcoming General Election.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: By introducing a £10,000 threshold for income tax that will make people up to £700 a year better off.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fair start for all children at school
keyPolicies.policyDescription: By introducing a Pupil Premium that will help support the most disadvantaged children in our society.
By investing in cleaner, greener technologies.
By reform of the political system, including the right to sack MPs, cleaning up party funding, and the introduction of fair votes.

issues.economy: Shadow Chancellor, Vince Cable, was right about the economy – that it was unbalanced and over-reliant on a consumer borrowing spree and fantasy house prices.
issues.governance: Reform of the political system with the right to sack MPs, cleaning up party funding, and the introduction of fair votes.

leaflet.personalStatement: I live in West Bridgford and have for nearly 30 years. I'm a magistrate and a Visiting Professor at De Montfort University in Leicester. I run my own pharmaceutical consultancy. I spent 34 years in the development of medicines with major UK pharmaceutical companies.

politicalExperience.role: Borough Councillor for the Musters Ward in West Bridgford
politicalExperience.achievements: Effective scrutiny of council decisions, vigorously opposing unsustainable development, such as that at Sharphill, and seeking to ensure value for taxpayers' money.

contactInformation.address: 76 Melton Road West Bridgford Nottingham NG2 6FJ

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet provides personal background about Karrar Khan and outlines key Liberal Democrat policies and reforms. Specific mentions of achievement and roles are included as well as a brief note about the candidate's personal history and connection to the area.
